title: Lagmore Avenue - Cycling Improvement Scheme - to Mar 26
description:
Belfast - a pedestrian and cycle improvement scheme in Lagmore Avenue, Belfast, part of the Belfast Cycling Network Delivery Plan, that includes segregated cycle tracks along Lagmore Avenue between the junction of Stewartstown Road and Glenfearna Park will commenced on 10 March 2025.


To help ensure the safety of road users and our road workers, it will be necessary to operate daily lane closures along Lagmore Avenue between 9.30am and 4.00pm (Mon- Fri) from 10 March until late March 2026.


Once completed this scheme will deliver improved active travel connections to local schools and amenities in the Lagmore area.

title: Ballynakilly Road, Coalisland - Closed 15 Sep - 18 Dec 2025
description:
Co Tyrone – Ballynakilly Road will be closed from from Moor Road to Dungannon Road.


Continuously from 08:00 Mon 15 Sep to 19:00 Thu 18 Dec 2025.


Reason for closure: To enable construction of Creenagh Bridge Replacement and Carriageway works


The anticipated delay will be 15 - 30 minutes


An alternative route will be signed with traffic being diverted via:

  • Diversion 1: A0045 Ballynakilly Road, B0520 Moor Road, B0161 Annagher Road,B0161 Moor Road, B0520 Stewartstown Road, B0520 Lineside, A0045 Dungannon Road, A0045 The Square

  • Diversion 2: U7675 Ballynakilly Road, A0045 Dungannon Road, A0045 The Square, B0520 Lineside, B0520 Stewartstown Road, B0161 Annagher Road, B0161 Moor Road, B0520 Moor Road

Notes: Motorway HGV traffic to use M1 Junction 15 as an alternative route.

title: Benburb - Maydown Road - Closure - Public Safety
description:
Temporary Continuous Road Closure to part of C184 Maydown Road, Benburb from its junction with B128 Clonfeacle Road to its junction with C186 Carrickaness Road.


This closure is required in the interests of public safety due to the partial collapse of a retaining wall and carriageway.


A local diversion is in operation via B128 Clonfeacle Road, B128 Blackwatertown Road, C185 Artasooly Road and C184 Maydown Road. 


Please ensure to allow additional time for your journey.

title: Lisburn - Ballynahinch Rd Resurfacing Nov 25 - Feb 26
description:
Lisburn - a footway and carriageway resurfacing scheme on Ballynahinch Road, from the junction of Young Street to Strawberry Hill Lane commenced on Monday 3rd November 2025.  


To facilitate the scheme, it will be necessary to implement a full road closure between Young Street and Strawberry Hill Lane, during the hours of 9.00am and 17.00pm (Mon to Fri only) until the end of February 2026.  


Ballynahinch Road closed between Young Street and Comber Road for resurfacing access to residents and Carnbrooke Meats will be maintained.

 

The Department has programmed the work operations and traffic management arrangements to minimise inconvenience, however, while steps have been taken to accommodate local access, road users should expect some delays and are advised to allow additional time when travelling in the vicinity of the works and are asked to comply with all temporary traffic restrictions.  

 

Subject to favourable weather conditions, the works will be substantially complete by Friday 27 February 2026, however, the Department will keep the public informed of any change.

title: Ballycastle - Glenshesk Rd Reopened with Ln Restriction
description:
Glenshesk Road, Ballycastle reopened to traffic on Monday 1 December 2025 with a lane closure in place to facilitate the construction of a masonry parapet.


This final piece of work is anticipated to be completed throughout the month of December, and the Department hopes to have all temporary traffic management removed as soon as possible; however, it must be stressed that work of this nature is weather dependant.

title: Kilrea – Kilrea Bridge Reopened
description:
Kilrea - Kilrea Bridge Reopened with Restrictions

 

The temporary stabilisation works are now well advanced and the road has been reopened to cars and light vehicles, up to 3 tonnes, on Saturday 6 December. Access over the bridge will be controlled using a 2.5m width restriction at both ends of the bridge to ensure safety through the ongoing site works while permanent repairs continue.

 

The Permanent repair works are continuing to progress as planned and are expected to finish by mid-February 2026. Once complete, the road will fully reopen to all vehicles.

 

The bridge remains an active construction site and restrictions are in place for the safety of our workers. Ignoring or breaching these restrictions could lead to suspension of the works and closing to all traffic until the permanent works are complete.

title: General Traffic News
description:
• North Down - Seahill - report of a 4 - 5 vehicle road traffic collision heading in the Belfast direction on the A2 Belfast to Bangor around Seahill Road (the Devils Elbow) at the traffic signals - lane 1 is obstructed - delays can be expected (14:19)


  • North Belfast - report of a fallen telegraph pole on the Cavehill Road at the Jct Charnwood Avenue blocking the road - extra care if in the area. (WITH BT OPENREACH TO SORT (14:10)



In the Greater Belfast area traffic is busy on the following routes:-

  • Great Victoria St towards the city centre
  • Dunbar Link headign round to York St

title: General Traffic News
description:
Belfast: The traffic signals at Stoney Road Ardcan Way are out. Road users should approach with caution and be prepared to STOP and GIVE WAY until repairs can be completed.(12:54)



  • Belfast: York Street / Frederick Street / Dunbar Link- the Pedestrian crossing at the Ulster University Campus has been damaged in a road traffic collision Thursday lunchtime. Repairs have commenced but will not be a quick fix and the crossing could be out of operation for a number of days. Road users are advised to approach with caution and be prepared to Stop and Give Way as necessary - given the high volume of pedestrians in the area. (11:37)


No other incidents or delays to report currently

title: Winter Driving - PSNI - Safety Advice
description:
Winter weather conditions are to continue over the weekend and we’re urging motorists to take extra care on the roads.

 

Ice is forecast throughout NI, and a Yellow Weather Warning is in place until 10:00 Tuesday 6th January.

 

You can find advice on driving in winter on our website - https://www.psni.police.uk/safety-and-support/roads-and-driving/winter-driving-safety-advice

The anticipated delay will be 5 - 15 minutes.


The Department will keep the public informed of any change.

title: Belfast - NIE Works Grosvenor Rd from 27 Jan 2026
description:

It will also be necessary to close a traffic lane on Howard Street for the straight-ahead traffic to Grosvenor Road. Please allow additional time for your journey.

title: Coleraine Circular Rd NIW Pipelaying - Mon 2 Feb for 6 Weeks
description:
Pipelaying for new development gets underway, Circular Road, Coleraine

 

NI Water is scheduled to commence essential pipelaying work on Circular Road in Coleraine next week to provide the necessary wastewater infrastructure to support a new development.

 

The work will include the laying of a new surface water pipe and the construction of 4 new manholes on Circular Road between Anderson Park and the new development (near the junction with Abbey Street).  

  

Pipelaying work will commence on Circular Road adjacent to the entrance to The Mall on Monday 2nd February and will take approximately 6 weeks to complete.

 

To enable works to be carried out safely, a lane closure will be required on Circular Road around any working area for the duration of the project. 

 

Before the pipelaying work gets underway, trial holes along Circular Road will be take to ascertain the location of existing services.

 

NI Water have said every effort will be made to minimise disruption and complete the work as quickly as possible.

description:

The closure will be in place between Saintfield Road and Bailiesmill Road and is required to repair subsidence on the carriageway following a period of heavy rain.

 

During this time an alternative route will operate via Saintfield Road, Carryduff Road, Belfast Road, Main Street, Harmony Road, Windmill Road, the Square, High Street, Lisburn Street, Lisburn Road.

 

The Department apologies for any convenience caused however the safety of the travelling public is our priority. Please abide by he road closure signs and follow the signed diversion.

description:
Belfast - A55 Milltown Road – 4 Weekends - Road Closures for Resurfacing commencing Friday 30th January 2026

 

The A55 Milltown Road will be closed for the next four weekends starting 9.00 pm on Friday the 30th January until 6.00 am on Monday the 2nd February for major resurfacing works.

title: Belfast A55 Milltown Rd Weekend Closures Resurfacing Feb 26
description:
To facilitate the scheme, it will be necessary to implement full road closures over four weekends.


The first weekend closure commenced at 9pm on Friday 30 January and finish at 6am on Monday 2 February 2026.


Three further weekend closures will also be required

  • 6 – 9 February
  • 13 – 16 February
  • 20 – 23 February

The works cover the section from Belvoir Road to Belvoir Drive.


One lane will remain open towards Malone Road on Friday nights and on Saturdays until 10.00 pm. This is to accommodate public transport and local access only.


Access to the Crowne Plaza Hotel, local sports clubs and Shaws Bridge will be maintained from the House of Sport roundabout. There will be no access beyond Belfast Indoor Bowls Club.


A signed diversion will operate via Upper Malone Road, Drumbeg Road, Ballylesson Road and Hospital Road.


There will be no access to Belvoir Estate or Milltown Hill from Milltown Road during the closures.


Drivers should allow extra time for their journeys.


The Department apologises for any inconvenience caused.

title: A512 Creighton Road, Belfast – Resurfacing Scheme
description:
A512 Creighton Road, Belfast – Resurfacing Scheme will commence on Thursday 29 January 2026.


To facilitate the scheme, it will be necessary to implement full road closures over four weekends.


The first weekend closure will commence at 7.00 pm on Friday 30 January and finish at 6.00 pm on Sunday 1 February 2026.


Three further weekend closures will also be required

  • 6 – 8 February
  • 27 February – 1 March 2026
  • 6 – 8 March

In addition to these weekend closures, lane closures will be in place on Creighton Road throughout the duration of the works, commencing on Thursday 29 January 2026.


During each of these weekends the road will also be closed from 7.00 pm on Friday until 6.00 pm on Sunday.


During periods of closure a diversion route will operate via Stewartstown Road, Upper Dunmurry Lane and Old Golf Course Road.


Road users are asked to comply with all temporary traffic restrictions and to drive with care when travelling in the vicinity of the road works.


The Department has programmed the work operations and traffic management arrangements to minimise inconvenience however, whilst steps have been taken to accommodate local access, road users should expect some delays and are advised to allow additional time when travelling in the vicinity of the works.

  

Subject to favourable weather conditions, the works are anticipated to be completed by Friday 13 March 2026.


The Department will however keep the public informed of any change.

title: A23 Ballygowan Rd – Resurfacing Lane / Weekend Closures
description:
Belfast - A resurfacing scheme will commence on the Ballygowan Road, Belfast between Upper Knockbreda Road (A55) and Manse Road on Monday 9 February 2026.


From 9 February 2026 to 27 February 2026 lane closures will be utilised on the road each day near its junction with the A55 Upper Knockbreda Road to facilitate essential kerbing works.


Over a series of weekends from Friday 27 February 2026 to Sunday 29 March 2026 the road will be closed each weekend from 7pm on Friday to 6am on Monday. One lane will remain open in the country-bound direction towards Ballygowan until 6.30pm on Saturday to facilitate essential movement and local access. 


During road closures a signed diversion will operate via Upper Knockbreda Road, Saintfield Road, Cairnshill Road and Manse Road.


Given the proximity of Roselawn Cemetery and La Mon Hotel, road users are advised to allow additional time for their journey during these weekend closures and to follow the diversion route in place.


Whilst arrangements have been planned to minimise inconvenience some delays should still be expected, and all temporary traffic restrictions should be observed. Subject to favourable weather conditions the works are anticipated to be substantially complete by 29 March 2026.


The Department apologises for any inconvenience caused.

title: Ards & North Down - A20 and A2 Coastal Roads
description:
A Yellow Weather warning for Rain is in place from midday Thursday 5 February and 23:59 Friday 2026.


Road users are advised of potential overtopping waves and debris being deposited on A20 between Newtownards and Portaferry and the A2 between Portaferry and Groomsport during the current weather warning.


During the current high tide or the next two that fall within the timescale of the weather warning there is potential for driving conditions to be problematic but as yet they are not considered treacherous.


While the roads remain open to traffic roads users are advised to exercise extra care while driving along these coastal routes and to key an eye out for possible hazards.

title: Old Golf Course Rd R`bout Weekend Closures Feb 26
description:
Belfast Old Golf Course Road Roundabout, carriageway resurfacing scheme.


To facilitate the scheme, it will be necessary to implement full road closures on A512 Old Golf Course Road Roundabout, Old Golf Course Road and Creighton Road over two consecutive weekends of 14 and 15 February and 21 and 22 February 2026.


The first weekend closure will commence at 9.00 pm on Saturday 14 February until 8pm on Sunday 15 February 2026. The second weekend closure will commence at 9pm on Saturday 21 February until 8pm on Sunday 22 February 2026.


During periods of closure diversion routes will operate as follows:


Diversion 1- via Blacks Road, Stewartstown Road, Upper Dunmurry Lane for traffic travelling to and from West Belfast.


Diversion 2 – via McKinstry Road, The Cutts, Railway View, Kingsway, Blacks Road for traffic travelling to and from the Lisburn area.


The Department has programmed the work operations and traffic management arrangements to minimise inconvenience however, whilst steps have been taken to accommodate local access, road users should expect some delays and are advised to allow additional time when travelling in the vicinity of the works. Road users are asked to comply with all temporary traffic restrictions.  


Subject to favourable weather conditions, the works are anticipated to be completed by Sunday 22 February 2026.The Department will however keep the public informed of any change.

title: General Traffic News

Crumlin - Road users are advised that the Budore Road is currently closed due to a burst water main. A road closure has been installed between the junctions of Thorndale Road and Divis Road. Local diversion in place via Quarterlands Road / Carnaghliss Road / Ballynill Road


Elsewhere no other reports of any incidents or delays.

title: Great Victoria Street Public Realm works
description:
As part of the ongoing public realm enhancement works associated with the Belfast Grand Central Station project, improvement works are due to take place on Great Victoria Street at the corner of Amelia Street.

 

These works will begin on Monday 16 February and are expected to be completed by the end of the month.

 

To safely complete footpath and kerb improvements, a short southbound lane closure will be in place after the pedestrian crossing, reopening just after Amelia Street. Pedestrian access at the corner of Amelia Street and Great Victoria Street will be maintained throughout.

 

Passenger Information –Metro 7 & 8

  • During these works, the Metro 7 & 8 stop at Great Northern Mall will be suspended.
  • Services will operate from the Metro 9 stop during this period.

 

Translink is continuing to encourage people to consider using public transport to access the city during these public realm works as road users may expect some delays in the area.

 

Passengers are encouraged to check www.translink.co.uk or the Journey Planner before travelling and to allow some extra time for their journey.

 

Translink would like to thank the public and passenger for their patience and cooperation during these essential works.

 

For further updates, please visit https://www.trafficwatchni.com/.

title: Comber, Bridge Street Link (Arrangements from Fri 13th Feb)
description:
Update - Bridge Street Link, Comber


The road will be open today 13/02/2026 at 1630 and will not be closed again until Sunday 22nd February,

description:

This closure will likely remain on for several hours, with a diversion in place via the A4 Dungannon Road, Northway, M12 and return to the M1 eastbound at the junction 11 (Ballynacor).

 

Further updates to follow once the closure is in place.
